top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race's Michigan rolling farmland gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race's Michigan farmland, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race. Train it until it feels boring.
At Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Michigan rolling farmland gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,500ft of climbing on Michigan rolling farmland gravel does to your power file on race day.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Michigan rolling farmland gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Barry-Roubaix Killer Gravel Road Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan farmland, rolling gravel, 100+ mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of michigan rolling farmland gravel in Hastings, Michigan.
